---
description: {{DESCRIPTION - One-line summary of what this command does}}
generated_by: livespec
generated_at: {{YYYY-MM-DD - Date generated}}
prompt: {{PROMPT-PATH - Path to prompt this command invokes}}
supports_parameters: {{true|false - Whether command accepts parameters}}
parameters:
  - name: {{PARAM-NAME - Parameter name}}
    values: {{[array, of, valid, values] - Valid parameter values}}
    default: {{DEFAULT - Default value if not specified}}
---

# {{Command Title}}

Use `{{PROMPT-PATH}}` {{with parameters: {{parameters}}}}

**What this does:** {{Description of what this command accomplishes}}

**When to use:** {{Context for when this command should be invoked}}

{{IF supports_parameters:}}
**Parameters:**
- `{{param-name}}`: {{Description of parameter}} ({{valid, values, list}})
  - Default: {{default-value}}
{{END IF}}

---

*This slash command was generated by LiveSpec. To customize, remove the `generated_by` field from frontmatter.*

---

## Template Notes

**Variable Replacement:**
- `{{DESCRIPTION}}` - One-line description from command mapping
- `{{YYYY-MM-DD}}` - Current date in ISO format
- `{{PROMPT-PATH}}` - Path to prompt file (e.g., dist/prompts/utils/complete-session.md)
- `{{Command Title}}` - Human-readable command name (e.g., "Complete Session")
- `{{parameters}}` - Parameter placeholder text if applicable
- `{{param-name}}` - Actual parameter name
- `{{Description of parameter}}` - What the parameter controls
- `{{valid, values, list}}` - Valid values for parameter
- `{{default-value}}` - Default if parameter omitted

**Conditional Sections:**
- Parameters section only appears if `supports_parameters: true`
- Parameter documentation shows valid values and default

**Customization Detection:**
- `generated_by: livespec` marks file as generated
- Removing this field indicates user customization
- Generation prompt will skip overwriting customized commands

**Examples:**

### Simple Command (No Parameters)

```markdown
---
description: End-of-session analysis with compliance and learning capture
generated_by: livespec
generated_at: 2025-11-17
prompt: dist/prompts/utils/complete-session.md
supports_parameters: false
---

# Complete Session

Use `dist/prompts/utils/complete-session.md`

**What this does:** Analyzes current session for compliance, captures learnings, and saves data globally for methodology improvement.

**When to use:** At session end (>100K tokens, all tasks done, natural stopping point, or user stuck).

---

*This slash command was generated by LiveSpec. To customize, remove the `generated_by` field from frontmatter.*
```

### Parameterized Command

```markdown
---
description: Strategic improvement recommendations from accumulated data
generated_by: livespec
generated_at: 2025-11-17
prompt: dist/prompts/utils/suggest-improvements.md
supports_parameters: true
parameters:
  - name: scope
    values: [all, context, registries, validation]
    default: all
---

# Suggest Improvements

Use `dist/prompts/utils/suggest-improvements.md` with parameters: {{scope}}

**What this does:** Analyzes accumulated feedback data and registries to provide prioritized improvement recommendations.

**When to use:** Monthly reviews, after multiple sessions, when methodology feels suboptimal, or before planning changes.

**Parameters:**
- `scope`: Limit analysis to specific area (all, context, registries, validation)
  - `all` (default) - Full analysis across all areas
  - `context` - Context efficiency only
  - `registries` - Registry health only
  - `validation` - Validation pass rates only

---

*This slash command was generated by LiveSpec. To customize, remove the `generated_by` field from frontmatter.*
```

### Router Command (Multiple Prompts)

```markdown
---
description: Run quality audits on project specifications
generated_by: livespec
generated_at: 2025-11-17
prompt: Multiple audit prompts (routed by type parameter)
supports_parameters: true
parameters:
  - name: type
    values: [minimalism, context, coverage, workspace-specs, workspace-scope, all]
    default: all
---

# Audit Project

Run quality audits on LiveSpec project specifications.

**What this does:** Executes audit prompts based on type parameter, checking specifications for quality issues.

**When to use:** Monthly reviews, before releases, when specs feel bloated, or when investigating project health issues.

**Parameters:**
- `type`: Audit type to run (minimalism, context, coverage, workspace-specs, workspace-scope, all)
  - `minimalism` - Check specs for over-specification (MSL principles)
  - `context` - Analyze context compression effectiveness
  - `coverage` - Verify all permanent files have specs
  - `workspace-specs` - Detect bloat/redundancy in workspace specs
  - `workspace-scope` - Verify workspace scope appropriateness
  - `all` (default) - Run all 5 audit types sequentially

**Router logic:**
- `minimalism` → Use `dist/prompts/utils/audit-msl-minimalism.md`
- `context` → Use `dist/prompts/utils/audit-context-compression.md`
- `coverage` → Use `dist/prompts/utils/audit-spec-coverage.md`
- `workspace-specs` → Use `dist/prompts/utils/audit-workspace-specs.md`
- `workspace-scope` → Use `dist/prompts/utils/audit-workspace-scope.md`
- `all` → Execute all 5 prompts in sequence, aggregate results

---

*This slash command was generated by LiveSpec. To customize, remove the `generated_by` field from frontmatter.*
```

---

## Generation Process

**When generate-custom-slash-commands.md runs:**

1. Reads this template
2. For each command mapping:
   - Replaces variables with actual values
   - Includes/excludes parameter section based on supports_parameters
   - Writes to `.claude/commands/livespec/[command-name].md`
3. Checks for customization (missing generated_by field)
4. Prompts before overwriting customized commands

**Validation:**
- All generated commands have complete frontmatter
- Prompt paths resolve to actual files
- Parameter documentation present when supports_parameters=true
- Router logic documented for multi-prompt commands
